title: CoreTech Supplier Quality Engineer
summary: Imagine what you could do here! At Apple, new insights have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it! Seeking an expert professional who brings expertise in the Optical manufacturing and quality management of high precision components for camera or other optical devices. As Core Technology Quality Engineers, they are responsible for driving quality improvement actions on future products. They enable mass production capable manufacturing processes and develop plans to validate / verify new product quality at each development breakthrough. They approach problems in an engineering method and make data-driven decisions. Quality Engineers also bring up capable suppliers which can implement at a high level on an ongoing basis.
description: -  Work with vendors to setup robust quality system, control plan, quality gates and conduct audits to ensure vendors are consistently meeting Apple quality standards. -  Partners with supply chain functional teams to define, validate and optimize module CTQ requirements, quality control plan, spec limits, and guard-bands.  -  Digitize quality readiness dashboard and quality matrix to keep track of factory quality ramp readiness and quality performance from development stage until mass production. -  Participate in Engineering and Ops Core Team meetings to influence quality requirements. -  Host task force meetings, collaborate with cross-function teams and vendors in resolving quality or reliability issues/excursion, RCCA, prevention, and disposition plan. -  Lead supply chain inspection, dimension, and test metrology correlation. -  Hands-on in data analysis to deep dive the root cause, to predict and prevent for better quality control. -  Identified opportunities and bring in innovative ideas in driving Smart Quality initiatives, cost of quality reduction, green manufacturing, etc.
key_qualifications: -  Experience in developing Process Quality Plans (PQP), supplier quality audits, FMEA, 8D, FishBone, and DOEs. -  Proficient in Quality tools, metrology, MSA, GDnT, SPC, CPK, GRR, and Correlation. -  Proficient with statistical and data analytical skill and familiar with JMP / Minitab / Tableau or equivalent tools. -  Fluent in English and Chinese written and oral communication. -  Experience in Optical technology, test and metrology are preferred. -  Experience in defining cosmetic inspection conditions, specifications, and limit samples are preferred. -  Excellent on net-it-out communications and exec level presentations.
preferred_qualifications: Master/BS, or equivalent experience with at least 5 years of industry experience in Optics, Physics, Opto-mechanics, or Electrical Engineering. Experience in electro-optical modules assembly, inspection and test process development/manufacturing.
